title: Drawing, "Design for Potato Peeler", January 24, 1991
medium: Photocopy with graphite on white wove paper
inscribed: Printed ink black ink, lower margin above title block: (delta symbol) 1 BLADE ASSEMBLY BLOCK REVISED / (delta symbol) 2 DIMENSION CHANGED FROM 48.0 R TO 47.0 R / NOTE: TOP BLADE BLOCK REMOVED; printed in title block:   STRAIGHT PEELER  / DRAWN MHC /  SCALE FULL / DATE 1.17.90 / SMART DESIGN INC. / APPROVED REV. 5 [delta symbol] / REVISION (delta symbol) 1.24.91 / DRAWING NUMBER 219.
provenance: Smart Design, Inc., New York, NY, prior to 2011
dimensions: 28 x 42.7 cm (11 in. x 16 13/16 in.), folded (dimensions approximate)
description: Peeler with handle and blade supported by a curved element is seen in full from above and from the side, with additional details at left, depicting the blade hole and block in cross-section, and at right, the handle in two different cross-section views.  These drawings have been greatly annotated with comments in graphite, and there are specifications about dimensions of each component throughout. The drawing space is framed by a ruled border and contains a title block in the lower margin, right.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for Potato Peeler", January 24, 1991. Photocopy with graphite on white wove paper. Gift of Smart Design, Inc.. 2011-50-29.
